verses.kjv: But a certain man named Ananias, with Sapphira his wife, sold a possession,
verses.ct: Now a man named Ananias, along with his wife Sapphira, sold a piece of property.

verses.kjv: And kept back part of the price, his wife also being privy to it, and brought a certain part, and laid it at the apostles’ feet.
verses.ct: He held back some of the money for himself, and his wife knew about it. Then he brought the rest and placed it at the apostles' feet.

verses.kjv: But Peter said, Ananias, why hath Satan filled thine heart to lie to the Holy Ghost, and to keep back part of the price of the land?
verses.ct: Peter said, "Ananias, why has Satan filled your heart so that you would lie to the Holy Spirit and keep back part of the money from the land?

verses.kjv: Whiles it remained, was it not thine own? and after it was sold, was it not in thine own power? why hast thou conceived this thing in thine heart? thou hast not lied unto men, but unto God.
verses.ct: Before you sold it, wasn't it yours? And after you sold it, wasn't the money yours to do with as you pleased? Why did you plan this in your heart? You haven't lied to people — you've lied to God."

verses.kjv: And Ananias hearing these words fell down, and gave up the ghost: and great fear came on all them that heard these things.
verses.ct: When Ananias heard these words, he collapsed and took his last breath. Everyone who learned about this was deeply shaken.

verses.kjv: And the young men arose, wound him up, and carried him out, and buried him.
verses.ct: The young men got up, wrapped his body, carried him out, and buried him.

verses.kjv: And it was about the space of three hours after, when his wife, not knowing what was done, came in.
verses.ct: About 3 hours later, his wife came in, not knowing what had happened.

verses.kjv: And Peter answered unto her, Tell me whether ye sold the land for so much? And she said, Yea, for so much.
verses.ct: Peter asked her, "Tell me — did you and your husband sell the land for this amount?" She answered, "Yes, that was the price."

verses.kjv: Then Peter said unto her, How is it that ye have agreed together to tempt the Spirit of the Lord? behold, the feet of them which have buried thy husband are at the door, and shall carry thee out.
verses.ct: Peter said to her, "How could you two agree together to test the Spirit of the Lord? Look — the men who buried your husband are right at the door, and they will carry you out too."

verses.kjv: Then fell she down straightway at his feet, and yielded up the ghost: and the young men came in, and found her dead, and, carrying her forth, buried her by her husband.
verses.ct: Instantly she fell down at his feet and took her last breath. When the young men came in, they found her dead, carried her out, and buried her next to her husband.

verses.kjv: And great fear came upon all the church, and upon as many as heard these things.
verses.ct: The entire church and everyone else who heard about these events was deeply shaken.

verses.kjv: And by the hands of the apostles were many signs and wonders wrought among the people; (and they were all with one accord in Solomon’s porch.
verses.ct: The apostles performed many signs and wonders among the people. All the believers would gather together in Solomon's Colonnade.

verses.kjv: And of the rest durst no man join himself to them: but the people magnified them.
verses.ct: No one else dared to associate with them, but the people held them in high regard.

verses.kjv: And believers were the more added to the Lord, multitudes both of men and women.)
verses.ct: Still, more and more people — crowds of both men and women — kept putting their trust in the Lord.

verses.kjv: Insomuch that they brought forth the sick into the streets, and laid them on beds and couches, that at the least the shadow of Peter passing by might overshadow some of them.
verses.ct: People even carried the sick out into the streets and placed them on mats and cots, hoping that at least Peter's shadow might fall on some of them as he walked by.

verses.kjv: There came also a multitude out of the cities round about unto Jerusalem, bringing sick folks, and them which were vexed with unclean spirits: and they were healed every one.
verses.ct: Crowds also came from the towns surrounding Jerusalem, bringing those who were sick or tormented by evil spirits, and every one of them was healed.

verses.kjv: Then the high priest rose up, and all they that were with him, (which is the sect of the Sadducees,) and were filled with indignation,
verses.ct: Then the high priest and all his associates, who belonged to the party of the Sadducees, were filled with jealousy.

verses.kjv: And laid their hands on the apostles, and put them in the common prison.
verses.ct: They arrested the apostles and threw them into the public jail.

verses.kjv: But the angel of the Lord by night opened the prison doors, and brought them forth, and said,
verses.ct: But during the night, an angel of the Lord opened the prison doors, led them out, and said,

verses.kjv: Go, stand and speak in the temple to the people all the words of this life.
verses.ct: "Go stand in the temple and tell the people the full message of this new life."

verses.kjv: And when they heard that, they entered into the temple early in the morning, and taught. But the high priest came, and they that were with him, and called the council together, and all the senate of the children of Israel, and sent to the prison to have them brought.
verses.ct: They obeyed and entered the temple at dawn and began teaching. Meanwhile, the high priest and his associates arrived and called together the council — the full assembly of Israel's elders — and sent officers to the jail to bring the apostles before them.

verses.kjv: But when the officers came, and found them not in the prison, they returned, and told,
verses.ct: But when the officers got there, they didn't find them in the jail. They went back and reported,

verses.kjv: Saying, The prison truly found we shut with all safety, and the keepers standing without before the doors: but when we had opened, we found no man within.
verses.ct: "We found the prison securely locked with the guards stationed at the doors, but when we opened up, no one was inside."

verses.kjv: Now when the high priest and the captain of the temple and the chief priests heard these things, they doubted of them whereunto this would grow.
verses.ct: When the captain of the temple guard and the chief priests heard this report, they were completely baffled, wondering where this would lead.

verses.kjv: Then came one and told them, saying, Behold, the men whom ye put in prison are standing in the temple, and teaching the people.
verses.ct: Then someone arrived and told them, "The men you put in jail are standing in the temple, teaching the people!"

verses.kjv: Then went the captain with the officers, and brought them without violence: for they feared the people, lest they should have been stoned.
verses.ct: So the captain went with his officers and brought them back — but without using force, because they were afraid the crowd would stone them.

verses.kjv: And when they had brought them, they set them before the council: and the high priest asked them,
verses.ct: They brought the apostles in and made them stand before the council. The high priest questioned them,

verses.kjv: Saying, Did not we straitly command you that ye should not teach in this name? and, behold, ye have filled Jerusalem with your doctrine, and intend to bring this man’s blood upon us.
verses.ct: saying, "We gave you strict orders not to teach in this name! Yet you've spread your teaching all over Jerusalem, and you're trying to make us responsible for this man's death."

verses.kjv: Then Peter and the other apostles answered and said, We ought to obey God rather than men.
verses.ct: Peter and the other apostles replied, "We must obey God rather than human authorities.

verses.kjv: The God of our fathers raised up Jesus, whom ye slew and hanged on a tree.
verses.ct: The God of our ancestors raised Jesus back to life — the one you killed by hanging him on a cross.

verses.kjv: Him hath God exalted with his right hand to be a Prince and a Saviour, for to give repentance to Israel, and forgiveness of sins.
verses.ct: God elevated him to his right hand as Leader and Savior, to offer Israel the opportunity to repent and receive forgiveness of sins.

verses.kjv: And we are his witnesses of these things; and so is also the Holy Ghost, whom God hath given to them that obey him.
verses.ct: We are witnesses to these things, and so is the Holy Spirit, whom God has given to those who obey him."

verses.kjv: When they heard that, they were cut to the heart, and took counsel to slay them.
verses.ct: When they heard this, they were furious and wanted to have them killed.

verses.kjv: Then stood there up one in the council, a Pharisee, named Gamaliel, a doctor of the law, had in reputation among all the people, and commanded to put the apostles forth a little space;
verses.ct: But a Pharisee named Gamaliel, a respected teacher of the law who was honored by all the people, stood up in the council and ordered that the apostles be taken outside for a short time.

verses.kjv: And said unto them, Ye men of Israel, take heed to yourselves what ye intend to do as touching these men.
verses.ct: Then he said to the council, "People of Israel, think carefully about what you're planning to do with these men.

verses.kjv: For before these days rose up Theudas, boasting himself to be somebody; to whom a number of men, about four hundred, joined themselves: who was slain; and all, as many as obeyed him, were scattered, and brought to nought.
verses.ct: Some time ago, Theudas appeared, claiming to be someone important. About 400 men rallied behind him. But he was killed, and all his followers scattered and came to nothing.

verses.kjv: After this man rose up Judas of Galilee in the days of the taxing, and drew away much people after him: he also perished; and all, even as many as obeyed him, were dispersed.
verses.ct: After him, Judas of Galilee came along during the time of the census and attracted a following. He also died, and all who followed him were scattered.

verses.kjv: And now I say unto you, Refrain from these men, and let them alone: for if this counsel or this work be of men, it will come to nought:
verses.ct: So my advice to you now is this: stay away from these men and leave them alone. If their plan or movement is merely human in origin, it will collapse on its own.

verses.kjv: But if it be of God, ye cannot overthrow it; lest haply ye be found even to fight against God.
verses.ct: But if it comes from God, you won't be able to stop them. You may even find yourselves fighting against God."

verses.kjv: And to him they agreed: and when they had called the apostles, and beaten them, they commanded that they should not speak in the name of Jesus, and let them go.
verses.ct: The council was persuaded by his argument. They called the apostles back in, had them beaten, ordered them not to speak in the name of Jesus, and released them.

verses.kjv: And they departed from the presence of the council, rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer shame for his name.
verses.ct: The apostles left the council full of joy because they had been considered worthy to be dishonored for the sake of the name of Jesus.

verses.kjv: And daily in the temple, and in every house, they ceased not to teach and preach Jesus Christ.
verses.ct: Every day, both in the temple and from house to house, they never stopped teaching and proclaiming that Jesus is the Christ.
